page.title: 18Llanrhychwyn Church
page.content: The church lies at the eastern edge of the upland country west of the valley, east of Llyn Geirionydd 25Om high. The church was originally a small rectangular building, possibly 12th cent., and known traditionally as Llywelyn's church and may have been used by Llywelyn ap Iorwerth before Trefriw church was built. The font is possibly older than the church itself. Small and square in shape, it may date from 11th or 12th cent.The bell is 14th cent. and probably came from Maenan Abbey.The gravestones are of very special interest, and were included in a recent project to record gravestones carried out by the Womens Institute Trefriw.The church is in use during spring and summer months attended by local people and visitors. During 1984/5 weddings & christenings have been celebrated here.
